issue.title: Filter issue causing problem with and android app
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard DNS

### AdGuard version

dns.adguard.com

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

the problem is with app, not a site

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.kaufland.Kaufland&hl=ro&gl=US

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
Hello, on my android device I'm using dns.adguard.com as my private DNS, The issue is with a retailer app (kaufland app -package:com.kaufland.Kaufland). Since an update about 3 weeks ago, whenever I try to access the leaflet (the supermarket catalogue) from within the app get a network error. If I revert the phone to my ISP DNS, the app works normal, so I guess it is a bad AdGuard filter. Can you please fix it? Thanks.


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/75840436/173083326-98640e6a-7519-44c1-bcf6-44c65e5ccd71.mp4




### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
Fixed for Android app (without DNS protection enabled).
 DNS will take a while.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: instagram.com
issue.body:
@Nzzyme commented on [Thu May 26 2022](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardBrowserExtension/issues/2082)

https://www.instagram.com/p/Cd_cSNJls9g/

Using Edge Browser with AG extension for Edge. No ad/tracking filters applied. Only the "Stealth" mode is applied with the following settings: https://prnt.sc/YZh3D9na8Fym

Still when I reload the page, no videos play on Instagram (logged in). Disabling AG Extension and then reloading the page plays the video. Please fix.
 

---

@Nzzyme commented on [Thu May 26 2022](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardBrowserExtension/issues/2082#issuecomment-1138578729)

I am not sure where should this be posted as it is not related to any filter. Can you please check and move the post to the right section?

comment.body:
> > No ad/tracking filters applied. Only the "Stealth" mode is applied[...]
> > Still when I reload the page, no videos play on Instagram (logged in).
> 
> What happens if you enable `AdGuard Base filter`?
> 
> I can reproduce issue with video if I disable all filter lists and enable Stealth mode, but this issue should be already fixed in Base filter by this rule:
> 
> ```
> @@||scontent*.cdninstagram.com^$stealth
> ```

It works with this rule. Can you tell me what does this rule mean? Does it bypass the Stealth mode for that domain?

review.body:
I noticed there are three `#article-1_5` rules in Mobile filter:
```
sutekinakijo.com,news.2chblog.jp,kyousoku.net,waranote.livedoor.biz###article-1_5
tsubamesoku.blog.jp,blog.esuteru.com###article-1_5
girlsvip-matome.com,onecall2ch.com,gahalog.2chblog.jp,michaelsan.livedoor.biz,chaos2ch.com,bipblog.com,news4vip.livedoor.biz,akb48matomemory.com,doorblog.jp,jin115.com,himasoku.com,blog.livedoor.jp##.article-list-outer > li#article-1_5
```
I checked quickly and apprently all these can be merged into one rule of `...###article-1_5`; i.e. `article-list-outer > li` specification is not needed. Furthermore, it seems `#article-1_5` is always leftover and there's no `#article-1_4` or `#article-2_5` so I think `sutekinakijo.com,news.2chblog.jp,`, `gahalog.2chblog.jp`, `waranote.livedoor.biz`, `news4vip.livedoor.biz`,  and `tsubamesoku.blog.jp` can be trimmed down to `2chblog.jp,livedoor.biz,blog.jp###article-1_5` so that all subdomain will be covered, particularly as we already did so for `blog.livedoor.jp` and `doorblog.jp`.

Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
